Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.simplex

Class Simplex

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.simplex.Simplex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Simplex extends Object implements Serializable

Simplex multi-dimensional minimization algorith which was originally proposed by Nelder, J.A. and Mead, R., 1965, Computer Journal, v. 7, pp. 308-313. This implementation was translated from a C++ version published by Press, W. H., S. A. Teukolsky, W. T. Vetterling and B. P. Flannery (2002), Numerical Recipes in C++, The Art of Scientific Computing, 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press.

*

This version performs function evaluations in parallel model. There is also a parallel version that performs multiple function evaluations sequentially.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2008

    • search

      public double search(double[] x, double[] dx, boolean restart) throws Exception
      Multi-dimensional minimization of the function simlexFunction(double[] x) where x[0..ndim-1] is a vector in ndim dimensions.

      This method added by Sandy Ballard 03/20/2015

      Parameters:
      x - on input: an initial guess at the ndim model parameters. On output: contains the ndim model parameters at the minimum point.
      dx - on input: the size of initial simplex in each of the ndim dimensions. On output: the size of the final simplex in each of the ndim dimensions.
      Returns:
      double the value of simplexFuntion(x) evaluated at the minimum point.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • search

      public double[] search(double[][] p) throws Exception
      Multi-dimensional minimization of the function simlexFunction(double[] x) where x[0..ndim-1] is a vector in ndim dimensions. The matrix p[0..ndim][0..ndim-1] is input. Its ndim+1 rows are ndim-dimensional vectors that are the vertices of the starting simplex. On output, p will have been reset to the ndim+1 new points all within tolerance of the a minimum function value. Returns the value of the fitness function at each of the vertices of the simplex.

      p and y are reordered such that y[0] holds the smallest function value and p[0] holds the corresponding set of parameters.

      Parameters:
      p - double[][]
      Returns:
      double[]
      Throws:
      Exception

    • search

      public double[] search(Amoeba amoeba) throws Exception
      Multi-dimensional minimization of the function simlexFunction(double[] x) where x[0..ndim-1] is a vector in ndim dimensions. The matrix p[0..ndim][0..ndim-1] is input. Its ndim+1 rows are ndim-dimensional vectors that are the vertices of the starting simplex. On output, p will have been reset to the ndim+1 new points all within tolerance of the a minimum function value. Returns the value of the fitness function at each of the vertices of the simplex.

      p and y are reordered such that y[0] holds the smallest function value and p[0] holds the corresponding set of parameters.

      Parameters:
      p - double[][]
      Returns:
      double[]
      Throws:
      Exception

    • isParallelMode

      public boolean isParallelMode()
      If parallelMode is true then the (ndim+1) test points of the amoeba are all evaluated in parallel. Otherwise they are evaluated sequentially.

    • setParallelMode

      public void setParallelMode(boolean parallelMode)
      If parallelMode is true then the (ndim+1) test points of the amoeba are all evaluated in parallel. Otherwise they are evaluated sequentially.
